title: Talk with us, Lord, Thyself reveal

author.name: Charles Wesley
author.bio: Charles Wesley was a leader of the Methodist movement, most widely known for writing over 6,000 hymns. He was the younger brother of Methodist founder John Wesley. Charles Wesley's hymns have had a significant impact on Protestant hymnody, known for their theological depth, lyrical beauty, and expression of profound religious experience. His works include hymns like 'Hark! The Herald Angels Sing' and 'Love Divine, All Loves Excelling,' which remain popular in Christian worship around the world.

lyrics:
Talk with us, Lord, Thyself reveal,
While here o'er Earth we rove;
Speak to our hearts, and let us feel
The kindling of Thy love.

With Thee conversing, we forget
All time, and toil, and care;
Labour is rest, and pain is sweet
If Thou, my God, art here.

Here then, my God, vouchsafe to stay,
And bid my heart rejoice;
My bounding heart shall own Thy sway,
And echo to Thy voice.

Thou callest me to seek Thy face;
'tis all I wish to seek;
To attend the whispers of Thy grace,
And hear Thee only speak.

Let this my every hour employ,
Till I Thy glory see:
Enter into my Master's joy,
And find my Heaven in Thee.
